stories.title: Alibaba's Arm-based 128 core CPU will send a shiver down spines at Intel and AMD

stories.text:
Power always rules. People are manipulated by those in power. The masses are almost always led rather than doing the leading.

At the end of the day what matters most is that people can lead relatively free private lives.

Technology and modern society are chipping away at that stated goal of democracy and allowing people to be manipulated by ginned up outrages and fears.
stories.title: Democracy Is a Ruse

If You’re Getting a W-2, You’re a Sucker

stories.text:
In the past year or two I have noticed the astonishing proliferation of the word "take" in online comments to mean opinion / interpretation / understanding / point of view on a topic.

To me gratuitous linguistic mimicry is some times a sign of a weak independent thinking capability.

we were able to converse before using the verb "take" in a weird idiomatic way.

What's your take on how this happened?
stories.title: Evolving language “What's your take?”
